$!You can search the online Trade Tariff tool for commodity codes.$!

Commodity codes classify goods for import and export so that you pay the right tax and duty and follow regulations. You must have a commodity code for all goods you want to import or export to and from the UK. 

Use the [online Trade Tariff](/trade-tariff "Trade Tariff") to search for commodity codes.

There is also [help with classifying goods.](/specialist/classification-of-goods "help with classifying goods")

Once you found the correct codes, the Trade Tariff lists everything else you may need to import or export your goods, for example: 

- import/export licences or any special regulations for your goods (called ‘measures’) 
- duty to pay
- VAT to pay
- duty and tax reliefs  
- exemptions from licences etc in certain countries 
- customs procedures that apply to your goods 

If you can’t find your goods on the Trade Tariff contact the helpline.

$C
**Tariff enquiries**  
<customer.services@tso.co.uk>  
**Telephone:** 0844 4777 414  

$C

You can also buy the [print version of the Trade Tariff.](http://www.tsoshop.co.uk/bookstore.asp?FO=1160035&DI=577406 "Buy the Trade Tariff print version"){:rel="external"}

##Wrong codes and penalties

%It’s your responsibility to get your commodity code right, even if you use an agent.%

If you import or export goods with the wrong code, HM Revenue & Customs can fine you, seize your goods and delay their release from customs.
overview: Use a commodity code to classify goods for import and export - pay the right tax and duty
title: Finding commodity codes for import and export duty
